articles.title: Kim Jong Un Guides Fire Drill of Ballistic Rockets
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Guides Fire Drill of Ballistic Rockets
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the Workers' Party of Korea, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army(KPA), provided field guidance to the fire drill of ballistic rockets by Hwasong artillery units of the KPA Strategic Force.
					 Hwasong artillery units of the KPA Strategic Force were involved in the drill. Those units are tasked to strike the bases of the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in the Pacific operational theatre in a contingency.
					
					 The drill was conducted to reexamine the reliability such as the flight security and guided accuracy of the improved ballistic rockets deployed for action, and to assess and inspect the capabilities of the units for action.
					
					 Upon arriving at the firing site, he learned in detail about the plan for the drill and the tactical and technical specifications of the improved ballistic rockets. Then he issued an order to the commander of the Strategic Force to start the drill.
					
					 The moment General Kim Rak Gyom shouted "Fire!" ballistic rockets flew into the sky in succession.
					
					 The units' capability for fighting a real battle and the combat performance of the rockets were appreciated as perfect at the drill.
					
					 Through the drill the Hwasong artillery units of the KPA Strategic Force demonstrated before the world their military might as a strong service capable of mounting a preemptive attack on the enemies any time and from any place.
					
					 He expressed great satisfaction over the successful successive firing drill of ballistic rockets and congratulated the Hwasong artillery men of the KPA Strategic Force involved in the drill.
					
					 He stressed the need to continue making miraculous achievements in bolstering up the nuclear force one after another in this historic year when Juche Korea made an eye-opening curtain raiser by succeeding in the H-bomb test and set forth tasks of bringing the military deterrent on a higher stage by developing the Juche-oriented nuclear force in every way.
					
					 The drill was observed by senior officials of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea including Ri Man Gon, Ri Pyong Chol and Kim Jong Sik and officials in the field of national defence science research.

articles.title: 8th Congress of UAWK to Be Held
articles.content:
8th Congress of UAWK to Be Held
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 8th Congress of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) is to be held in Pyongyang early in December, Juche 105 (2016).
					 The congress will review successes and experience gained in the work of the union since its 7th Congress and discuss the tasks and ways to be fulfilled by the union organizations as an ideological and educational organization. 
					
					 The 8th Congress of the union will be an epochal occasion of providing a milestone for the whole union to remain loyal to the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un and put the work of the union onto a new high stage under the leadership of the great Party.

articles.title: National Reunification Prize Awarded to Contributors to Country's Reunification
articles.content:
National Reunification Prize Awarded to Contributors to Country's Reunification
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- National Reunification Prize was awarded to members who made contribution to the country's reunification.
					 According to the Aug. 30 decree of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, the prize was awarded to Kim Yang Gon, Kang Kwan Ju, Ri Jun Song, Kim Ryu Hwan, Kim Yong Gwan, Ri Jong Man, Jong Jin Hwan, Ho Hong Sik, Ri U Gap, Jong Kyu Jin and Chae Chang Guk.
					
					 They dedicated their all to the sacred struggle to build a dignified and prosperous reunified power on this land, upholding the line of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on national reunification.

articles.title: National Sci-Tech Festival Closes
articles.content:
National Sci-Tech Festival Closes
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 31st national sci-tech festival closed with due ceremony at the Sci-Tech Complex Tuesday.
					 The participants heard more than 570 scientific research and technical innovation successes.
					
					 The Communication Industrial Institute of the Latest Science Institute of Kim Il Sung University, Hwanghae Iron and Steel Complex, Sunchon Chemical Complex, Electronic Engineering Department of Kim Chaek University of Technology, Nature Energy Institute of the State Academy of Sciences and other units won top places and over 50 units including the Chollima Steel Complex, the Agricultural Nano Technology Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science, the Pyongyang Cornstarch Factory and Sinuiju Chicken Farm placed first.
					
					 Present at the closing ceremony were Choe Thae Bok, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, Kim Tok Hun, vice-premier, Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission, Jang Chol, president of the State Academy of Sciences, officials concerned, scientists, technicians, teachers and three-revolution team members.

articles.title: Anniversary of Mangyongdae Aeguk Aluminum Sash Factory Marked
articles.content:
Anniversary of Mangyongdae Aeguk Aluminum Sash Factory Marked
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Mangyongdae Aeguk Aluminum Sash Factory marked the 30th anniversary of its founding.
					 The factory is the modern base for producing the building-materials which was developed thanks to the far-reaching plan of capital city construction of the great leaders. 
					
					 President Kim Il Sung visited the factory which was built by the patriotic efforts of Koreans in Japan, watched production processes and equipment and indicated the tasks and ways to increase the aluminum sash production.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il gave the honorable task to the factory which began operation on the 38th founding anniversary of the DPRK on Sept. 7, Juche 75 (1986) and led it to contribute to putting the construction on an industrial and modern basis by steadily improving the technological process.
					
					 During the past three decades since its foundation, the factory developed into a reliable base for producing aluminum fixtures of the country and made contribution to realizing the Party's Juche-oriented architectural idea and construction plan.   
					
					 A meeting to mark the 30th anniversary of the factory was held Tuesday. 
					
					 Present there were O Su Yong, vice-chairman of the C.C., the Workers' Party of Korea (WPK), Jo Sok Ho, chairman of the Capital City Construction Commission, officials concerned and officials and employees of the factory.
					
					 A congratulatory message of the C.C., the WPK to workers, technicians and officials of the factory was read out at the meeting.

articles.title: DPRK Focuses on Flood Damage Rehabilitation
articles.content:
DPRK Focuses on Flood Damage Rehabilitation
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The DPRK government concentrates its efforts on flood damage rehabilitation in North Hamgyong Province of the country.
					 State measures have been taken to stabilize the life of inhabitants in the flood-hit areas and rehabilitate the destroyed dwelling houses and public buildings as early as possible.
					
					 Relief goods and building materials are rapidly supplied on a nationwide scale to the flood-stricken areas.
					
					 Meanwhile, emergency rehabilitation steps were taken by the province. A brisk campaign was launched to restore destroyed houses, railways, roads and bridges and drain off standing water in paddy and dry fields, clear out ditches and improve river embankments.
					
					 In recent days, some areas of the province were hit hard by stormy rainfalls and flooding.
					
					 The flooding in the province left more than 60 people dead and 25 missing and 7,980 hectares of paddy and dry fields submerged and 2,100 hectares buried or washed away.
					
					 Besides, 560 public buildings, 30 production buildings and nearly 20 educational buildings were destroyed or inundated. The flood also destroyed roads extending 79,800 meters at about 50 places and bridges of 2,215 square meters at six places and a dam of power station.

articles.title: National Symposium on Vegetable and Legume Seed Production Held
articles.content:
National Symposium on Vegetable and Legume Seed Production Held
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The National Symposium on Vegetable and Legume Seed Production in the DPRK was held at the Pyongyang Vegetable Science Institute of the Academy of Agricultural Science on Sept. 5 and 6.
					 Attending the symposium were officials and researchers of the Academy of Agricultural Science, ministries, national institutions, scientific research and education and other relevant fields and staff members of the European Union Programme Support here.
					
					 The speakers referred to the growing attention to the vegetable and legume seed production in the DPRK and the significance of the research on this.
					
					 They expressed expectation that the symposium would be a good opportunity for exchanges of success and experience in vegetable and legume production.
					
					 They gave a scientific explanation of the issues of establishing the system of vegetable and legume seed production and steadily increasing the production.

articles.title: 42nd National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize Closes
articles.content:
42nd National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize Closes
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 42nd National Schoolchildren's Sports Contest for Jongilbong Prize closed with due ceremony at the hall of the youth league on Tuesday.
					 The contest was held, divided into senior secondary, junior secondary and primary schools. They competed in 17 events including basketball, volleyball, table-tennis, speed skating, Taekwon-Do and Ssirum (Korean wrestling).
					
					 Pyongyang City came first in team standings.
					
					 45 players were selected as April 18 best players.

articles.title: Turkish President Hopes for Reconciliation and Unity of North and South of Korea
articles.content:
Turkish President Hopes for Reconciliation and Unity of North and South of Korea
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Cha Kon Il, DPRK ambassador to Turkey, presented his credentials to Recep Tayyip Erdogan, president of the Republic of Turkey, on Aug. 31.
					 The Turkish president said his country regarded the DPRK as an amicable country and he would send fair support and solidarity to the DPRK as ever, hoping for good mutual cooperation on international arena.
					
					 The president noted it is tragic that the Korean nation is divided. He said he thought it is the best way for the Korean people to achieve the national reunification by themselves free from any foreign interference as the Korean nation was divided by foreign forces. He hoped that Korea would be a reunified power by achieving the reconciliation and unity of the north and the south.

articles.title: Diplomats Visit Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons
articles.content:
Diplomats Visit Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Diplomatic envoys and representatives of international bodies here Tuesday visited the Kumkop General Foodstuff Factory for Sportspersons on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The guests looked round various production processes of the factory.
					
					 They also visited the Pyongyang Sports Apparatus Factory that day.

articles.title: Pyongyang Sushi Restaurant Opened
articles.content:
Pyongyang Sushi Restaurant Opened
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang Sushi Restaurant was opened Tuesday with due ceremony.
					 The two-storied restaurant consists of various rooms including a hall capable of accommodating more than a hundred of people where dozens of kinds of sushi and varieties of dishes are served and a hall where dishes ordered by computer are served with the help of belt conveyer.
					
					 Present there were officials concerned, officials and employees of the restaurant and Pyongyangites

articles.title: Director of IIJI Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Director of IIJI Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A director of the International Institute of the Juche Idea and his party laid a floral basket before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill on Tuesday to pay tribute to them.

articles.title: Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Kim Jong Un from Indian President
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, chairman of the State Affairs Commission of the DPRK, received a message of greeting from Pranab Mukherjee, president of the Republic of India, on Sep. 2.
					 The president in the message extended warm greetings and congratulations to Kim Jong Un and the people of the DPRK on behalf of the government and people of India and on his own behalf on the founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 The relations between the two countries are characterized by traditional fraternity and friendship, the message said.
					
					 It expressed pleasure over the fact that the two governments are cooperating in boosting bilateral relations in various fields in line with the mutual interests of the peoples of the two countries.
					
					 India wished for peace and stability in the region and wanted all of pending issues to be solved through dialogue as soon as possible, the message added.
					
					 It most sincerely wished Kim Jong Un good health and happiness and the people of the friendly DPRK steady progress and prosperity.

articles.title: Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
articles.content:
Floral Basket to Kim Jong Un from Lao President
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket from Lao President Bounnang Vorachith on the 68th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 The floral basket was conveyed to an official concerned by Phonekham Inthaboualy, Lao ambassador to the DPRK, on Tuesday.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter from Military Attaches Corps
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Receives Floral Basket, Congratulatory Letter from Military Attaches Corps
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un received a floral basket and congratulatory letter from the military attaches corps here on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 They were handed to Army General Pak Yong Sik, minister of the People's Armed Forces, by Military, Naval and Air Attache of the Chinese Embassy here Zhang Ping who is doyen of the corps on Tuesday.

articles.title: Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair
articles.content:
Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The 12th Pyongyang Autumn International Trade Fair goes on in the DPRK, starting on September 5.
					 Taking part in it are more than 280 companies from 15 countries and regions, including the DPRK.
					
					 Lim Chun Horng, manager of Malaysia's Mamee-Double Decker SDN. BHD, noted that streets of Pyongyang are very clean and its citizens are very kind.
					
					 Expressing his pleasure over the fair, he said he would further develop cooperation with the DPRK's businesses.
					
					 Loh Jwee Poh, managing director of Singapore's Unifood International (S) Pte Ltd., said that the Pyongyang trade fair is very interesting and he would attend the fair next year, too, adding that his firm is a soya milk producer well known in Singapore.
					
					 Tricia Koh, sales and marketing executive of Singapore's A-Linkz Marketing PTE LTD, noted that her firm presented many kinds of fruit juice to the Pyongyang Spring International Trade Fair in May. This time we are here with refined and pure olive oil, canned fruits and other new goods, she said, wishing success in the fair.

articles.title: Brisk Work for Improving Educational Conditions in DPRK
articles.content:
Brisk Work for Improving Educational Conditions in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A brisk work has been conducted in the DPRK to renew the educational conditions and environment.
					 The construction of buildings Nos. 3 and 4 at Kim Il Sung University is now progressing apace while a swimming pool is being built in real earnest at Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					
					 A modern library appeared at Chongjin University of Mining and Metallurgy.
					
					 Efforts were paid to turning Kim Chaek University of Technology, Pyongyang Han Tok Su University of Light Industry and other major universities into a center of education and scientific research and a base for international academic exchange.
					
					 Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School was developed into a model of the secondary education. And such work was launched in each province to renew the educational institutions and their environment.
					
					In the country's general secondary education field, at least 3,200 classrooms have been newly arranged at 500-odd schools and 13,400 laboratory and practical training rooms renewed to meet the demands of the new century until now from February of the year.
					
					 Many schools were improved on a modern basis and new schools took their shapes one after another in local areas.
					
					 Supreme leader Kim Jong Un in his report to the 7th Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea said that the material and technical foundations of the education sector should be raised to the world level through a radical overhaul of the educational conditions and environment.

articles.title: On-site Medical Service Activities Brisk
articles.content:
On-site Medical Service Activities Brisk
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- On-site medical service activities are brisk in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 In particular, medical workers from the Pyongyang Medical College Hospital of Kim Il Sung University have carried on their service in Taehongdan County, Ryanggang Province for 10 years.
					
					 In this regard, Kim Sun Nam, head of a department of the Taehongdan County People's Committee, told KCNA:
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il in his lifetime had cared so much for the health of discharged soldiers, who volunteered to work in Taehongdan County, and their families.
					
					 True to his intention, the hospital formed an on-site medical service squad to work in the county.
					
					 Thanks to the squad's devoted efforts, a youth of a construction company could recover his health from burns and a 15-year-old girl could recover from a walking disorder.
					
					 Han Chun Song, vice-director of the Pyongyang Medical College Hospital, said:
					
					 On the basis of the achievements and experience gained in the past, the hospital has intensified its on-site medical service in the county this year, too.
					
					 It provided the on-site medical squad with scores of kinds of medicines and some 1 800 pieces of medical appliances of over 20 kinds, including abdominal supersonic equipment.
					
					 The squad has made medical checkup and treatment services day and night, paying special care to disabled soldiers and serious cases.
					
					 Meanwhile, it organized tens of rounds of training courses to raise surgical skills of the local doctors.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do Popularized in DPRK
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do Popularized in DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A drive for popularizing Taekwon-Do is getting brisk in the DPRK.
					 The Korean Taekwon-Do Committee has directed big efforts to the work for disseminating Taekwon-Do among schoolchildren.
					
					 Recently there was a training course for sports teachers from different schools in Pyongyang City.
					
					 According to Pak Song Ryong, an instructor of the committee, the course, divided into theory and practice, focused mainly on the basic movements of Taekwon-do patterns and self-defence art, offensive and defensive by hands and foot.
					
					 Also instructors of the committee conducted guidance over Taekwon-Do groups at different schools.
					
					 After the course, its participants expressed their will to run the Taekwon-Do groups at their schools in an effective way and intensify the dissemination of Taekwon-Do among schoolchildren.

articles.title: KCNA Commentary on "Tax War" between U.S. and EU
articles.content:
KCNA Commentary on "Tax War" between U.S. and EU
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A new "tax war" broke out between the European Union and the U.S.
					 Recently the EU decided to levy a heavy fine on the U.S. multinational Apple Corporation on the basis of the three-year-long investigation into its tax evasion.
					
					 The EU Commission made a final decision that the Apple Corporation is obliged to pay the exempted taxes to Ireland, claiming that for an individual corporation to get a special benefit in taxation contravenes the EU legislation.
					
					 Commenting on this, media said that the EU again imposed the heaviest fine on the Apple in the wake of making a decision on collecting additional taxes running into a stupendous amount of money from the U.S. companies in Netherlands and Luxembourg despite friction with the U.S., adding that this was, in fact, a declaration of a "war against tax evasion."
					
					 The U.S. deserves this maltreatment as it imposed unequal economic relations on other countries, pursuing their own unchallenged interests.
					
					 As well known, the U.S. is a rogue state without an equal as it regards it as its state policy to perpetrate economic aggression and plunder of other countries and regions.
					
					 The free trade and the like much touted by the U.S. is nothing but a hypocritical artifice to invade and subjugate other countries and regions economically.
					
					 This is evidenced by the remarks of the U.S. ambassador to Seoul that south Korea-U.S. free trade agreement will play a symbolic role of binding south Korea to the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. economic policies, neo-colonial policies are now in force in disregard of domestic act and international law as they pursue financial benefits for a handful of conglomerates.
					
					 As disclosed to public, the U.S. conglomerates including the Apple are operating at least 1 600 bogus accounts in tax havens and the amount of the funds hidden by 50 companies of the U.S. amounts to 1 400 billion U.S. dollars.
					
					 Muddy spring will have muddy streams. The U.S. conglomerates operating overseas cannot do otherwise.
					
					 The Apple justified the tax evasion, claiming that it contributed to the job creation in Ireland and development of European economy.
					
					 Even the U.S. government is pressurizing the EU to rescind the decision, threatening to double the taxes the European companies are obliged to pay in the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. Department of Treasury asserted that the EU additional taxation is little short of robbing U.S. tax payers of money.
					
					 These reckless remarks are no more than sophism spouted by the U.S. which has become corpulent by sacrificing the interests of other countries.
					
					 It is a legitimate measure of the EU for the defence of economic interests that it decided to levy a fine on the U.S. corporation despite the U.S. threat and blackmail.
					
					 World media attributed the EU's decision to the American Empire's arrogant hegemonic policy now under fire worldwide.
					
					 The U.S. "sanctions" against the DPRK prove ineffective, bitterly rebuffed, as they run counter to the universally accepted international laws including the UN Charter. 
					
					 The U.S. had better stop its rash acts, bearing in mind that its arrogant practices are censured and derided by an increasing number of countries.

articles.title: DPRK Will Continue Exercising Self-Defensive Right: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
DPRK Will Continue Exercising Self-Defensive Right: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The United States is prodding its satellites at the UN into slandering test-fire of SLBM of the DPRK, and busying itself seeking a way of "intensifying deterrent" together with Japan and south Korean puppet forces.
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday, commenting on this, says the U.S. is seriously mistaken if it thinks sanctions would settle everything.
					
					 The DPRK has had access to the powerful nuclear deterrent in the spirit of self-reliance and self-development and indomitable will despite the unprecedented U.S. pressure and blockade, not in a good condition and circumstances, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The U.S. had better bear in mind that as long as it persists in its nuclear threat and arbitrary practices, the DPRK will never take even a step back from bolstering up nuclear deterrence.
					
					 It is none other than the U.S. that creates the danger of a nuclear war on the Korean peninsula and disturbs peace and security in the region and the rest of the world.
					
					 The DPRK is bolstering up powerful nuclear deterrence both in quantity and quality after having access to it. This is the just self-defensive step to cope with the U.S. ever more reckless madcap hostile policy toward the DPRK and nuclear threat.
					
					 The U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail that lasted for over half a century compelled the DPRK to have access to nuclear weapons whereas the U.S. hostile policy toward the DPRK that has become all the more undisguised even now when the latter ranked itself among nuclear powers has resulted in pushing the DPRK to putting its nuclear force on a high level.
					
					 Independence, Songun and socialism are the immutable path of the DPRK.
					
					 No one can block the DPRK advancing straight along this road.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Puppet Unification Minister of His Invectives against DPRK
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses S. Korean Puppet Unification Minister of His Invectives against DPRK
Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Hong Yong Phyo, puppet minister of Defense of south Korea let fly into Kazakhstan recently, where he talked about "north's abandonment of nuclear weapons" and "new opportunity", groundlessly pulling up the DPRK over its nuclear issue.
					Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary terms his remarks the imprudent invectives of the minister of confrontation who earned the worst fame in history.
					
					As for traitor Hong Yong Phyo, he is human scum branded as a disgusting waiting maid busying himself pleasing the mistress at Chongwadae in south Korea and heinous maniac for confrontation with compatriots, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					Such a traitor begged for cooperation in escalating confrontation with the DPRK while slandering compatriots not only at home but also in other country only to fully reveal his despicable true colors as cancer-like entity and trouble-maker of the nation harmful to improved inter-Korean relations and national reunification.
					
					Catastrophic north-south relations can never be repaired as long as such maniacs of confrontation keen on stifling compatriots indifferent to the national unity and reunification are allowed to go scot-free.
					
					We clearly warn once again the puppet forces that nothing will be more foolish and stupid than to hope to see "the north abandoning nuclear weapons".
					
					The futile moves of the Park Geun Hye group, obsessed by a wild ambition, will precipitate its ruin.

articles.title: Minju Joson Condemns Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition for Overseas Aggression
articles.content:
Minju Joson Condemns Japanese Reactionaries' Ambition for Overseas Aggression
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- It has been confirmed shortly ago that the Japanese Ministry of Defense is building a new type submarine, an improved version of Soryu, latest submarine of the Maritime "Self-Defense Force".
					 Japan is planning to start the research and development of electronic accelerated artillery piece also.
					
					 Recently the Japanese Ministry of Defense announced that it plans to allot more than 5 trillion yen, largest-ever in history, to the defense budget for fiscal year 2017 which will start from April next year.
					
					 Minju Joson Tuesday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 Japan is trying to squander a fabulous amount of money to modernizing arms and equipment. This is not because arms and equipment of the Japan "Self-Defense Forces" is more backward than others but it is aimed to realize the ambition for overseas aggression at any cost.
					
					 The Japanese minister of Defense in a recent press conference said "the security legislation" has entered the phase of full-scale enforcement.
					
					 The law grants the right to use armed forces, regarding the attack on its ally as the one on Japan. The enforcement of the law makes it possible for SDF to conduct military activities overseas as it wishes just as the Japanese imperialists were keen on overseas aggression in the past.
					
					 Japan neither admits nor makes apology and reparation for its heinous crimes against humanity committed in the past though 70 odd years have passed. It is as clear as noonday that in case Japan opts for overseas aggression, it would inflict monstrous disaster upon mankind.
					
					 But Japan should clearly understand that gone never to return are the days when Japan could trample down other countries and nations while brandishing swords of aggression at random.
					
					 Japan's overseas aggression will be self-ruin leading to defeat.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Mexico
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Mexico
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Nezauacoyotl City of Mexico on September 1 on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 Displayed at the venue of the meeting were photos dealing with exploits of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Exhibited there were their works, and books introducing Juche Korea.
					
					 Benigno Gonzales Villasana, chairman of the Mexico-Korea Friendship Association, said that Kim Il Sung, the eternal President of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea (DPRK), founded the Juche idea and led the great anti-Japanese war to victory to accomplish the cause of national liberation. The chairman went on:
					
					 The President founded the DPRK.
					
					 The great Comrade Kim Jong Il led socialism of Korea to victory by pursuing Songun politics, frustrated all aggressive moves of the imperialist allied forces and firmly defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country.
					
					 The respected Comrade Kim Jong Un is further strengthening the might of the DPRK.
					
					 Thanks to his leadership the Korean people are achieving epoch-making successes one after another scaring the hostile forces and encouraging the world progressive peoples.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of DPRK Observed by Myanmar Personage
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of DPRK Observed by Myanmar Personage
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Maung Maung Naying, director general of the Myit Tar Moe Publishing House of Myanmar, issued a statement on September 2 on the 69th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 He said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung wisely led the DPRK so that it could settle all issues by its own efforts in conformity with its specific conditions and the people's interests, consistently adhering to the principles of independence in politics, self-supporting in economy and self-reliance in national defence.
					
					 He is deeply revered by not only the Korean people but world progressives as he performed feats for the Korean revolution and the cause of human independence.
					
					 HE Kim Jong Il, true to the idea and cause of the President, made sure that the DPRK defended the interests and requirement of the people and thoroughly guaranteed their independent and creative life.
					
					 Under the guidance of HE Kim Jong Un the DPRK is advancing straight along the road of independence, Songun and socialism President Kim Il Sung and HE Kim Jong Il shaped and triumphantly led.
					
					 I extend firm support and solidarity to the Korean people's just struggle.

articles.title: Founding Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Angola, Indonesia
articles.content:
Founding Anniversary of DPRK Marked in Angola, Indonesia
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- A meeting and photo exhibition were held by the Committee of Angola for Friendship and Solidarity with Peoples and a lecture was given at the Milenia Armada Express Company of Indonesia on September 1 and 2 on the 68th anniversary of the founding of the DPRK.
					 Displayed at the venue of the photo exhibition were photos dealing with the immortal feats of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The director of the Social Education Department of the Committee of Angola for Friendship and Solidarity with Peoples said:
					
					 I extend the noblest tribute to President Kim Il Sung and HE Kim Jong Il, the great leaders of the Korean people, who performed immortal feats for the founding and strengthening of the DPRK.
					
					 The Korean people are making eye-opening miracles and innovations in building a socialist power despite persistent sanctions and pressure of the hostile forces.
					
					 All the achievements made in the DPRK are instilling the conviction of victory and courage into us struggling for the building of a new society and independent development.
					
					 I extend warm congratulations to the Korean people on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.

articles.title: Xinhua Introduces Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School
articles.content:
Xinhua Introduces Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Xinhua News Agency on Sept. 2 carried an article of a correspondent in the DPRK introducing Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School.
					 The article said:
					
					 Pyongyang Orphans' Secondary School is built in the DPRK as an example for secondary education.
					
					 When supreme leader Kim Jong Un visited the newly-built school, he expressed satisfaction over the arrangement of the school to be convenient to the orphans' study and life and in the light of curriculum.
					
					 All the classrooms are multi-functional and IT based and equipped with various types of school things which are good-looking and convenient to use.
					
					 Practice rooms are prepared for tailoring and cookery, which give the students a great help for acquiring a versatile knowledge.
					
					 There are also a gymnasium and playground with synthetic surfaces where students can build up their bodies after school.
					
					 The students are growing up to be talents who are knowledgeable, virtuous and healthy.

articles.title: Nigerian Organization Condemns U.S.-led Hostility toward DPRK
articles.content:
Nigerian Organization Condemns U.S.-led Hostility toward DPRK
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- The Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism posted an article denouncing the hostile moves of the U.S. and its followers against the DPRK on its website on Sept. 1.
					 The U.S. and its followers issued a press release accusing the DPRK's self-defensive measures of increasing the nuclear deterrent such as the SLBM test-fire at the UN Security Council, the article said, terming this a grave hostility towards the DPRK in wanton violation of its sovereignty and dignity.
					
					 The article continued:
					
					 The U.S. reckless moves such as kick-off of the largest-ever joint military drill through introduction nuclear strategic assets and huge troops into the Korean peninsula and the accusations against the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK escalate the regional situation and harass peace and stability on the peninsula.
					
					 The UNSC pays no heed to the DPRK's accusations of the U.S.-south Korea joint military drill seriously threatening the peace and stability on the peninsula and in its vicinity, but takes the side by the U.S. in the acute DPRK-U.S. confrontation bereft of impartiality as an international organization.
					
					 The U.S. and its followers should understand the will of the servicepersons and people of the DPRK to answer nuclear weapons of tyranny with nuclear weapons of justice and aggression war by righteous war for national reunification, and stop the anachronistic hostile moves against the DPRK at once.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Romanian Political Figure
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Romanian Political Figure
 Pyongyang, September 6 (KCNA) -- Vasile Orleanu, chairman of the Supreme Council of the New Socialist Party of Romania, posted an article on its website on Sept. 1 on the 68th founding anniversary of the DPRK.
					 The article said that President Kim Il Sung, the eternal leader of the Korean people, is the founder of the DPRK.
					
					 It went on:
					
					 The President, with a grand ambition for building a people's country in Korea in his early years, blazed a trail for the building of the people's government defending and realizing the interests of the working people from all walks of life including workers, farmers and intellectuals from an independent standpoint, not webbed to ready-made theories and experience in other countries.
					
					 Under his leadership, every democratic reform was successfully enforced in a short span of time, colonial and feudal remnants were wiped out in all fields of social life, national industry began to revive and a democratic educational and cultural system was established.
					
					 President Kim Il Sung led the country and the people, holding the top post of the country for a long period.
					
					 Under his leadership the DPRK beat back the U.S. which boasted of being the "strongest" in the world in the Korean war, honorably defended the sovereignty and dignity of the country and successfully carried out the postwar rehabilitation and construction and socialist construction of several stages.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicio de lanzamiento de cohetes balisticos
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un dirige ejercicio de lanzamiento de cohetes balisticos
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Kim Jong Un, Presidente del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y del Comite de Estado de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y Comandante Supremo del Ejercito Popular de Corea, dirigio en el terreno el ejercicio de lanzamiento de cohetes balisticos de las unidades artilleras Hwasong de las fuerzas estrategicas del EPC.
					En el adiestramiento militar tomaron parte las unidades artilleras Hwasong que se encargan de la mision de atacar en el tiempo de emergencia a las bases de tropas agresoras norteamericanas en la zona operacional del Pacifico.
					
					El presente lanzamiento se efectuo con el objetivo de revisar la estabilidad de vuelo, el acertamiento del misil teledirigido y otras credibilidades de los cohetes balisticos con funciones mejoradas que fueron emplazados para el combate y calificar la capacidad de la batalla real de las unidades citadas. 
					
					En el lugar de lanzamiento Kim Jong Un se cercioro en detalles el plan de ejercicio y los datos tactico-tecnicos de los cohetes con funciones mejoradas. Y luego dio la orden de realizar el entrenamiento al comandante de las fuerzas estrategicas. 
					
					Cuando el general de ejercito Kim Rak Gyom dio la orden de iniciar el golpe de fuego, se lanzaron sucesivamente los cohetes balisticos.
					
					En la ocasion fue evaluado que son perfectas la capacidad de manejo de cohetes de las unidades artilleras y la eficiencia combativa de los cohetes balisticos. 
					
					A traves del presente lanzamiento, se ha manifestado claramente el poderio militar de las unidades artilleras Hwasong de las fuerzas estrategicas del EPC fortalecidas como poderosa tropa capaz de asestar en cualquier lugar y momento el golpe sorpresivo a los enemigos. 
					
					Kim Jong Un mostro gran satisfaccion de la exitosa ejecucion del lanzamiento y felicito a los artilleros participantes en el ejercicio.
					
					Dijo que tienen que seguir ampliando los exitos prodigiosos  del fortalecimiento de fuerzas armadas nucleares logrados sucesivamente en este ano historico que se inicio con el trueno de la primera bomba H de Corea del Juche. Y presento las tareas para intensificar por todos los medios las autoctonas fuerzas armadas nucleares y llevar a la etapa mas elevada el disuasivo militar.
					
					Presenciaron el entrenamiento Ri Man Gon, Ri Pyong Chol, Kim Jong Sik y otros funcionarios responsables del CC del PTC y los funcionarios de la rama de investigacion de ciencia de defensa nacional.

articles.title: Convocatoria de VIII Congreso de UTAC
articles.content:
Convocatoria de VIII Congreso de UTAC
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Se convocara en la primera quincena de diciembre del 105 (2016) de la Era Juche en esta capital el VIII Congreso de la Union de Trabajadores Agricolas de Corea. 
					El conclave hara balance de los exitos y experiencias adquiridos en las labores de la UTAC despues del VII Congreso y discutira las tareas y remedios que se presentan ante las organizaciones de la UTAC como entidad de educacion ideologica. 
					
					El Congreso sera un motivo trascendental para llevar a una nueva etapa elevada las labores de la UTAC en acato fiel a la orientacion del Presidente Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Otorgado Premio Reunificacion de la Patria a contribuyentes a la causa de reunificacion
articles.content:
Otorgado Premio Reunificacion de la Patria a contribuyentes a la causa de reunificacion
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- En la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea fue otorgado el Premio Reunificacion de la Patria a Kim Yang Gon, Kang Kwan Ju, Ri Jun Song, Kim Ryu Hwan, Kim Yong Gwan, Ri Jong Man, Jong Jin Hwan, Ho Hong Sik, Ri U Gap, Jong Kyu Jin y Chae Chang Guk, quienes contribuyeron al cumplimiento de la causa de reunificacion de la patria. 
					Fue publicado el 30 de agosto el decreto correspondiente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC. 
					
					Los condecorados dedicaron todo lo suyo a la sagrada lucha por levantar sin falta sobre el territorio patrio una potencia reunificada y prospera, en acato a los lineamientos sobre la reunificacion de la patria, presentados por el Presidente Kim Il Sung y el Dirigente Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Clausurado XXXI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Tecnicas
articles.content:
Clausurado XXXI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Tecnicas
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Quedo clausurado el XXXI Festival Nacional de Ciencias y Tecnicas.
					Fueron publicados mas de 570 exitos logrados en la investigacion cientifica y renovacion tecnica.
					
					En el certamen ganaron el grado especial el Instituto de Industria de Comunicacion del Centro de Estudio de Ciencias Sofisticadas de la Universidad Kim Il Sung que logro exitos en la sustitucion con las nacionales las tecnicas de la red de comunicaciones de la proxima generacion, el Complejo Siderurgico de Hwanghae que establecio el proceso productivo del hierro Juche segun el metodo de inyeccion de oxigeno, el Complejo Quimico de Sunchon que acondiciono el proceso de produccion de pintura acrilica, la Facultad de Electronica de la Universidad Tecnica Kim Chaek que investigo y desarrollo las maquinas y equipos de nuevo tipo, el Instituto de Energia Naturales de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, la Direccion de la Industria de Maquina Rotativa del Ministerio de Industria Mecanica, etc.
					
					Tambien obtuvieron los primeros lugares mas de 50 unidades incluyendo el Complejo de Acero Chollima, el instituto de nanotecnologia agricola adscrito a la Academia de Ciencias Agricolas, la Fabrica de Procesamiento de Maiz de Pyongyang y la Granja Avicola de Sinuiju.
					
					Tuvo lugar el dia 6 el acto de clausura en el Palacio de Ciencias y Tecnicas.
					
					Estuvieron presentes Choe Thae Bok, vicepresidente del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el vicepremier Kim Tok Hun, Kim Sung Du, presidente del Comite de Educacion, Jang Chol, presidente de la Academia Estatal de Ciencias, otros funcionarios correspondientes, los cientificos, los tecnicos, los profesores y los miembros del grupo por las tres revoluciones.

articles.title: Presidente de Turquia desea que Corea se convirtiera en potencia reunificada
articles.content:
Presidente de Turquia desea que Corea se convirtiera en potencia reunificada
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- Cha Kon Il, embajador de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea en Turquia, presento sus cartas credenciales ante el presidente de la Republica de Turquia, Recep Tayyip Erdogan.
					   En la ocasion, el presidente dijo que Turquia considera la RPDC como pais amistoso y agrego que en el futuro tambien se continuaran el apoyo y la solidaridad justos con la RPDC y desea buena cooperacion reciproca en la arena internacional.
					
					   Menciono que la division de la nacion coreana es la tragedia producida por las fuerzas exteriores, por lo tanto, piensa que seria mejor si se logre la reunificacion con fuerzas propias de los coreanos sin intervenciones extranjeras, desea que Corea se convierta en la potencia reunificada mediante la reconciliacion y la unidad entre el Norte y el Sur.

articles.title: RPDC se concentra en resarcir danos de inundaciones de Hamgyong del Norte
articles.content:
RPDC se concentra en resarcir danos de inundaciones de Hamgyong del Norte
Pyongyang, 6 de septiembre (ACNC) -- La Republica Popular Democratica de Corea se concentra en los trabajos para resarcir los danos de inundaciones de la provincia de Hamgyong del Norte. 
					Se toman a escala nacional las medidas para estabilizar la vida de los moradores de la zona damnificada y reparar lo mas pronto posible las viviendas, edificios publicos y otros establecimientos destruidos. 
					
					En medio de que se fortalece la asistencia estatal en la esfera nacional se llegan los materiales de socorro a los moradores damnificados y se transportan con urgencia los materiales de construccion necesarias a la reparacion de los danos. 
					
					Basandose en el analisis detallado de los danos la provincia asegura los materiales necesarios y acelera los trabajos para resarcir los danos. 
					
					Impulsan las labores para reconstruir las viviendas destruidas y reparar en estado original los ferrocarriles, las carreteras y los puentes. 
					
					Reduce los danos de cultivos al drenar las aguas estancadas en los arrozales y secanos inundados y promueve la reparacion de zanjas y la construccion de dique. 
					
					Debido a las inundaciones ocurridas en la provincia, quedaron muertas 60 personas, y desaparecidas 25. 
					
					Ademas, fueron anegados mas de 7 mil 980 hectareas de arrozales y secanos, y enterradas o perdidas mas de 2 mil 100 hectareas. 
					
					Fueron desvastados o anegados 560 edificios publicos, 30 establecimientos productivos y cerca de 20 instituciones de ensenanza. 
					
					Tambien, fueron destruidos mas de 79 mil 8 cientos metros de cerca de 50 carreteras y firmes, 2 mil 215 metros cuadrados de 6 puentes y un dique de planta hidroelectrica.
